definition[0]: used after a word that you have copied in order to show that you know it was not spelled or used correctly
example[0]: We had seen several signs that said ‘ORANGE’S (sic) FOR SALE'.
definition[1]: to tell a dog to attack someone
example[1]: He sicced his dog on me.
definition[2]: to tell someone in authority that someone has done something wrong, so that they are punished
example[2]: He sicced his lawyers on them.
definition[3]: written abbreviation for STANDARD INDUSTRIAL CLASSIFICATION
